did.abstract: One bound scrapbook compiled by Jacob Myers and containing various news clippings and sample printing work of the Electric Printing Company, such as calling cards, advertisements, tickets, and invoice cards.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single volume.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Jacob Myers (d. 1901) resided at 1131 Lafayette Avenue in Brooklyn, and was an employee of the New York Times during the 1860s. He was also president of the Electric Printing Company, located at 25 Consilyea Street in Brooklyn.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Jacob Myers scrapbook, 1978.109, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One bound scrapbook compiled by Jacob Myers and containing various news clippings and sample printing work of the Electric Printing Company, such as calling cards, advertisements, tickets, and invoice cards. The volume was originally used as a mailing list for the New York Times. Contents of the scrapbook date from circa 1859 to 1876.
